verses.text_plain: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity builded the temple unto the Lord God of Israel;
verses.verse_html:
1Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity builded the temple unto the Lord God of Israel; ▼
▼ the children…: Heb. the sons of the transportation

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the children…: Heb. the sons of the transportation
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the children…: Heb. the sons of the transportation

verses.text_plain: Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to the chief of the fathers, and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice unto him since the days of Esar–haddon king of Assur, which brought us up hither.
verses.verse_html: 2Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to the chief of the fathers, and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice unto him since the days of Esar–haddon king of Assur, which brought us up hither.

verses.text_plain: But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the fathers of Israel, said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build an house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build unto the Lord God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.
verses.verse_html: 3But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the fathers of Israel, said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build an house unto our God; but we ourselves together will build unto the Lord God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.

tokens.text: unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build

verses.text_plain: Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,
verses.verse_html: 4Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,

verses.text_plain: And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
verses.verse_html: 5And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.

verses.text_plain: And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, wrote they unto him an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html:
6And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, wrote they unto him an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem. ▼
▼ Ahasuerus: Heb. Ahashverosh

verses.text_plain: And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian tongue, and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.
verses.verse_html:
7And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their companions, unto Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian tongue, and interpreted in the Syrian tongue. ▼
▼ Bishlam: or, in peace
 , ▼
▼ companions: Heb. societies

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Bishlam: or, in peace

verses.text_plain: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:
verses.verse_html:
8Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort: ▼
▼ scribe: or, secretary

verses.text_plain: Then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites,
verses.verse_html:
9Then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dinaites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites, ▼
▼ companions: Chaldee, societies

verses.text_plain: And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnappar brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest that are on this side the river, and at such a time.
verses.verse_html:
10And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnappar brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest that are on this side the river, and at such a time. ▼
▼ at such…: Chaldee, Cheeneth

footnotes.body_html: ▼ at such…: Chaldee, Cheeneth

verses.text_plain: This is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king; Thy servants the men on this side the river, and at such a time.
verses.verse_html: 11This is the copy of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto Artaxerxes the king; Thy servants the men on this side the river, and at such a time.

verses.text_plain: Be it known unto the king, that the Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the bad city, and have set up the walls thereof, and joined the foundations.
verses.verse_html:
12Be it known unto the king, that the Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the bad city, and have set up the walls thereof, and joined the foundations. ▼
▼ set up: or, finished
 , ▼
▼ joined: Chaldee, sewed together

footnotes.body_html: ▼ set up: or, finished
▼ joined: Chaldee, sewed together

verses.text_plain: Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so thou shalt endamage the revenue of the kings.
verses.verse_html:
13Be it known now unto the king, that, if this city be builded, and the walls set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so thou shalt endamage the revenue of the kings. ▼
▼ pay: Chaldee, give
 , ▼
▼ revenue: or, strength

verses.text_plain: Now because we have maintenance from the king’s palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified the king;
verses.verse_html:
14Now because we have maintenance from the king’s palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour, therefore have we sent and certified the king; ▼
▼ we have…: Chaldee, we are salted with the salt of the palace

footnotes.body_text: ▼ we have…: Chaldee, we are salted with the salt of the palace
footnotes.body_html: ▼ we have…: Chaldee, we are salted with the salt of the palace

verses.text_plain: That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
verses.verse_html:
15That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful unto kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed. ▼
▼ moved: Chaldee, made
 , ▼
▼ within…: Chaldee, in the midst thereof

tokens.text: may be made in the book

footnotes.body_text: ▼ within…: Chaldee, in the midst thereof
footnotes.body_html: ▼ within…: Chaldee, in the midst thereof

verses.text_plain: We certify the king that, if this city be builded again, and the walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side the river.
verses.verse_html: 16We certify the king that, if this city be builded again, and the walls thereof set up, by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side the river.

verses.text_plain: Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time.
verses.verse_html:
17Then sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and unto the rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time. ▼
▼ companions: Chaldee, societies

verses.text_plain: The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.
verses.verse_html: 18The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.

verses.text_plain: And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.
verses.verse_html:
19And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein. ▼
▼ I commanded: Chaldee, by me a decree is set
 , ▼
▼ made insurrection: Chaldee, lifted up itself

tokens.text: hath been made, and it is found

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I commanded: Chaldee, by me a decree is set
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I commanded: Chaldee, by me a decree is set

footnotes.body_text: ▼ made insurrection: Chaldee, lifted up itself
footnotes.body_html: ▼ made insurrection: Chaldee, lifted up itself

verses.text_plain: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them.
verses.verse_html: 20There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, which have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid unto them.

verses.text_plain: Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until another commandment shall be given from me.
verses.verse_html:
21Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not builded, until another commandment shall be given from me. ▼
▼ Give…: Chaldee, Make a decree

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Give…: Chaldee, Make a decree

verses.text_plain: Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?
verses.verse_html: 22Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?

verses.text_plain: Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.
verses.verse_html:
23Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power. ▼
▼ by force…: Chaldee, by arm and power

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by force…: Chaldee, by arm and power
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by force…: Chaldee, by arm and power

verses.text_plain: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
verses.verse_html: 24Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
